text: A 22-year-old female was diagnosed as Graves' disease with obviously elevated serum calcium and reduced parathyroid hormone levels. Dual-energy x-ray absorptiometry and chest enhanced computer tomography (CT) revealed severe osteoporosis and a significant enlargement of thymus. After the successful control of hyperthyroidism with methimazole, hypercalcemia was corrected, bone mineral density was improved and thymus also shrank obviously.
